channel.title: Just Browsing Changelog
channel.description: Changelog for the JustBrowsing LiveCD project

item.description:
Changelog:
* Add: Xwrapper override for xorg-server 1.16+
* Add: Samsung Unified Print Driver
* Add: VDPAU video decoding driver
* Add: dynamically update bookmark
* Major overhaul: jb-config GUI
* Settings: add Kiosk mode
* Settings: choose email provider for compose shortcut
* Settings: save/load installed printers
* Settings: save/load Wifi networks
* Settings: adjust mouse acceleration
* Settings: toggle touchpad tapping
* Settings: adjust screen backlight/dimming
* Settings: adjust screen timeout delay
* Settings: adjust/boot audio volume
* Settings: add save confirmation and log files
* Settings: add display auto/reset option
* Settings: rewrote tree row selection and revert mechanisms
* Syslinux: loglevel=0 to boot entries to suppress output
* Syslinux: add missing Arabic menu entry
* Syslinux: splash replaced, text color inverted
* Packaged: Chrome and Firefox profiles
* Packaged: home directory config files
* Packaged: Xorg configs and Polkit rules
* Shrink binaries: libxul.so, chrome, GoogleTalkPlugin
* Hold: NetworkManager 0.9.8.10 (password input dialog broken upstream for GTK2)
* Hold: archiso 15 (ISO structure altered)

Status:
* Updated to Firefox 31.0 (stable)
* Updated to Google Chrome 36.0.1985.125 (stable)
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.15.8
* 32-bit release
* 64-bit release
* OnlyFirefox release
* OnlyChrome release
* Torrent releases
* ISO size: 659 MB

Known bugs:
* Printer refresh does not auto-select driver
* Sometimes volume and mouse acceleration not restored on boot
* zRAM support installed but not enabled
* VPN support not tested
* Non-whitelisted keymaps not functional in Chrome 35+
* Broadcom BCM4311 wifi broken in kernel 3.15 (fixed in 3.16rc3)
* Bug reporting partially implemented

item.title: 2014-07-27 Testing (0.6-7)
item.description:
Changelog:
* Various

Changelog:
* Added: chrome-remote-desktop (server)
* Added: Hipmunk bookmark
* Chrome: added extension formerly named QuickOffice
* Fixed: missing Downloads folder
* Packaged: jb-config
* Packaged: custom systemd unit files
* Updated: i3lock-spy
* Updated: justbrowsing-adeskbar
* ISO: squashfs now uses XZ compression

Status:
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.15.4
* Also a 3.14LTS edition
* 32-bit release
* 64-bit release
* Torrent available
* ISO size: 635 MB

Changelog:
* Settings: boot parameter parser updated
* Settings: url parameters added
* Settings: backend added loading config
* Settings: backend added saving config
* Settings: GUI added changing default browser
* Settings: GUI added changing locale
* Settings: GUI added changing keymap
* Settings: GUI added toggling force clean profiles
* Settings: GUI added setting custom homepage
* Settings: uploaded to git repo
* Rewrote: syslinux locale and keymap menu
* Rewrote: syslinux virtual machine menus
* Rewrote: browser toggle to use x-www-browser
* Rewrote: panel dynamic resizing
* Updated: i3lock-spy (zoom fit patches)
* Updated: i3lock-sentry (CSS and placeholders)
* Replaced: gxkb with jbxkb (custom) keyboard layout tray applet
* Compressed: chrome, libxul.so (firefox), GoogleTalkPlugin binaries with upx
* Added: batterymon-clone laptop battery tray applet
* Added: ibus-lite, ibus-pinyin (Chinese), ibus-skk (Japanese), ibus-m17n (various)
* Added: ttf-bitstream-vera, ttf-droid, ttf-indic-otf, ttf-tibetan-machine
* Added: Intel i740 and i810 GPU firmware
* Added: Broadcom b43-firmware
* Added: Chinese (pinyin), Chinese (cangjie), Japanese (skk), Korean (romaja), Thai (kesmanne) ibus inputs
* Added: Hebrew and Vietnamese (tcvn) keymaps and locales
* Added .torrent download option

Status:
* Updated browsers to Firefox 30.0 (stable) and Google Chrome 35.0.1916.153 (stable)
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.15.3
* ISO size: 673 MB

Known bugs:
* Non-whitelisted keymaps not functional in Chrome 35+
* Broadcom BCM4311 wifi broken in kernel 3.15 (fixed in 3.16rc3)
* Networks save/load not implemented
* Printer save/load not implemented
* Bug reporting partially implemented

item.title: 2014-06-29 Testing (0.6-4)
item.description:
Changelog:
* Various

item.title: 2014-05-25 Nightly (0.6-3)
item.description:
Changelog:
* Re-added: google-talkplugin (Hangouts) plugin
* Firefox: various changes for the Australis UI
* Firefox: Default=1 (profiles.ini)
* Firefox: Classic Theme Restorer (Beta)
* Firefox: added RSS Icon in Awesombar
* Firefox: added Profilist
* Firefox: added Simple Locale Switcher
* Firefox: added Nuke Anything Enhanced
* Open in tab: Adblock Edge, Classic Theme Restorer, Tab Mix Plus
* Chrome: removed cruft from profile
* Chrome: reset flags
* Chrome: enabled new user profile management

Status:
* Updated browsers to Firefox 29.0.1 (stable) and Google Chrome 35.0.1916.114 (stable)
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.14.4
* ISO size: 649 MB

item.title: 2014-05-04 Nightly (0.6-2)
item.description:
Changelog:
* Firefox: various changes for the Australis UI
* Firefox: added Classic Theme Restorer
* Firefox: added RSS/atom feeds to bookmarks menu
* Chrome: removed Apps bookmark
* Chrome: set home to chrome://apps
* Fixed: touchpad settings (again)
* Added install.preset for jb-remaster

Status:
* Updated browsers to Firefox 29.0 (stable) and Google Chrome 34.0.1847.132 (stable)
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.14.2
* ISO size: 640 MB

item.title: 2014-04-14 Nightly (0.6-1)
item.description:
Changelog:
* Replaced: zenity lockdialog with gtkdialog version
* Silent boot: agetty --skip-login to autologin@.service
* Silent boot: kernel.printk = 3 3 3 3 to systctl.d
* Removed: perl, zenity, ttf-dejavu, linux-headers
* Removed: unused Adwaita and HighContrast themes
* jb-config: prevent more than one settings dialog
* Build system: downgrade to syslinux 6.02 (menu select/highlight not working in 6.03)
* ISO structure: updated archiso and syslinux files

Status:
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.14.1
* ISO size: 675 MB

Changelog:
* Experimental: Settings configurator (jb-config)
* Experimental: Printer support (CUPS w/ Gutenprint drivers)
* Enabled: avahi-daemon w/ mdns support
* Enabled: CUPS webUI
* Fixed: touchpad setting
* Fixed: volume hotkeys
* Fixed: copytoram menu entry
* Fixed: typo in F1.txt
* Locale: Vietnamese added
* Added ttf-msfonts

Status:
* Updated browsers to Firefox 28.0 (stable) and Google Chrome 34.0.1847.116 (stable)
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.13.8
* Updated to OpenSSL 1.0.1g (not vulnerable to "HeartBleed")
* IgnorePkg = python-xlib profile-sync-daemon
* ISO size: 691 MB

Known bugs:
* Firefox: old profile asks to reset
* Chrome: extensions not up to date
* jb-config: panel doesn't resize when changing resolution
* jb-config: change keymap not implemented
* jb-config: change locale not implemented
* jb-config: browser, VM, etc options not implemented
* jb-config: bug report tool broken

item.title: 2014-01-25 Nightly (0.5-4)
item.description:
Changelog:
* Added ipw2100-fw for Intel Wifi 2100
* Added ipw2200-fw for Intel Wifi 2200BG

Changelog:
* Boot parameter parser changed
* Boot parameter clean=true fixed
* Boot parameter zone=Continent\City (timezones) added
* Syslinux timezone menus added
* Syslinux F3 timezone cheatsheet
* Improve boot time: lz4 initrd instead of xz
* Update: xf86-video-qxl
* Debug: ALT+F2 (/tmp/debug) and Firefox (about:addons-memory)
* Hotkeys: ALT+F1 (switch browser), ALT+F5 to ALT+F9 (webapps)
* Fixed .sfs checksum and pkglist for ISO
* Locale: Brazillian actually Breton
* Locale: English (GB) fixed
* Locale: Greek added
* Locale: Sinhali removed
* Locale: Swedish added
* Keymap: Added missing flags
* Keymap: Dvorak added
* Keymap: Polish (same as US) in all gxkb
* Bookmarks: draw.io added
* Bookmarks: newegg camel removed
* Firefox: Remove Google Search Redirects added
* Firefox: Video Resumer added
* Firefox: Setting Sanity added
* Firefox: about:addons-memory added
* Chrome: rebuilt chrome profile
* Chrome: DuckDuckGo Home
* Chrome: Google Docs added
* Chrome: Hangouts added
* Chrome: WOT added
* Chrome: AddThis removed
* Chrome: Flashblock removed
* Chrome: TurnOffTheLights fixed
* Cleanup: Removed dupe backgrounds
* Cleanup: Removed python3 again
* jb-install: 0.1 alpha "live" and "persist" installer released

Status:
* Currently Firefox 26.0 (stable) and Google Chrome 32.0.1700.77 (stable)
* Currently Linux kernel 3.12.8
* IgnorePkg = python-xlib profile-sync-daemon
* ISO size: 603 MB

Known bugs:
* PXE boot not yet working
* If US keymap in gxkb config, defaults to US
* Some browser locales missing fonts
* Chinese and Japanese keymaps need ibus

item.title: Nightlies (0.5-2)
item.description:
See changelog for nightlies:
* Nightly: 20140107
* Nightly: 20140106
* Nightly: 20140104
* Nightly: 20140103
* Nightly: 20140102

Changelog:
* Boot parameter keymap=xx
* Boot parameter locale=xx
* Boot parameter clean=true
* Syslinux load keymap menus
* Syslinux video mode menus
* Syslinux help menus
* Set gxkb keymap option
* Set browser locale option
* Fresh/untouched browser profile option
* Browser wrapper scripts

Status:
* Currently Firefox 26.0 (stable) and Google Chrome 31.0.1650.63 (beta)
* Currently Linux kernel 3.12.5
* IgnorePkg = systemd systemd-sysvcompat python-xlib profile-sync-daemon

Known bugs:
* Chinese (both) and Japanese inputs don't work, require ibus
* Only 30 keymaps and 33 locales, need more support
* Holding systemd at release 204
* PXE boot is untested

Changelog:
* Upgraded autologin@.service
* GTK icon theme enabled
* Updated Firefox profile
* Update Chrome profile
* Fixes for Chrome slotting (symlinks)
* Chrome: installed camera app
* Firefox: tweaks to about:config
* Firefox: MoreInContent+ extension
* Removed python3
* Optimize ISO size each build
* Default volume 100% for all audio cards
* Change i3 default tiling to tabbed
* VirtualBox support
* VirtualBox RDP fixes
* Keyboard layout/keymap applet switcher (gxkb: us,fr,it,is)
* Fixes to autosize script
* PXE support

Status:
* Updated browsers to Firefox 26.0 (stable) and Google Chrome 31.0.1650.63 (beta)
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.12.5
* IgnorePkg = systemd systemd-sysvcompat python-xlib profile-sync-daemon

Known bugs:
* Holding systemd-204 because even ver.208 has slow shutdown
* VirtualBox support doesn't work 1 in 4 times, restart X
* PXE boot is untested

item.title: Nightlies (0.4-X)
item.description:
See changelog for nightlies:
* Nightly: 20131110
* Nightly: 20131029
* Nightly: 20131027
* Nightly: 20131025
* Nightly: 20131024
* Nightly: 20131022
* Nightly: 20131021
* Nightly: 20130819
* Nightly: 20130818
* Nightly: 20130817
* Nightly: 20130816
* Nightly: 20130815
* Nightly: 20130814
* Nightly: 20130813
* Nightly: 20130812
* Nightly: 20130810
* Nightly: 20130809
* Nightly: 20130808
* Nightly: 20130807
* Nightly: 20130806
* Nightly: 20130802
* Nightly: 20130801
* Nightly: 20130731
* Nightly: 20130730
* Nightly: 20130729
* Nightly: 20130728
* Nightly: 20130727
* Nightly: 20130726
* Nightly: 20130725
* Nightly: 20130723
* Nightly: 20130722
* Nightly: 20130721
* Nightly: 20130720

Changelog:
* New: added searchpreview to Firefox
* New: added flashfree, searchpreview and smart qrcode to Chrome
* New: re-enabled Chrome plugins, added flashfree whitelist
* New: upgrade-iso script to build nightlies
* Removed: google-talkplugin (hangouts)

Status:
* Updated browsers to Firefox 22.0 and Google Chrome 30.0.1566.2 dev
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.9.9
* IgnorePkg = python-xlib profile-sync-daemon

Known bugs:
* Some issues with Hangouts and/or Chrome when loading Gmail
* Lockscreen wallpaper still cut off
* Blinking cursors in QEMU and Virtualbox with std driver
* Blinking cursors in QEMU and Virtualbox with std driver
* Segmentation fault in QEMU with SPICE qxl driver

Changelog:
* New: kernel parameter hooks: default=chrome, vga=vmware, vmware=1366x768
* New: experimental xf86-video-qxl SPICE support
* New: loopback.cfg config file
* Rewrite: syslinux boot menu options
* Rewrite: browser toggle logic
* Rewrite: i3lock-sentry
* Fixed: UVC vertical flip for webcams installed upside-down
* Fixed: DuckDuckGo as default search engine in Firefox
* Fixed: lockscreen bruteforce logs failed attempts
* Fixed: use -vga vmware for resolutions above 1024x768 in QEMU
* Fixed: upstream fixed -vga=vmware black screen bug
* Packaged: updated i3lock-spy

Status:
* Manual intervention for ArchLinux /bin, /sbin, /usr/sbin merge to /usr/bin
* Updated browsers to Firefox 21.0 and Google Chrome 29.0.1521.3 dev
* Updated to Linux kernel 3.9.5
* IgnorePkg = python-xlib google-chrome-dev profile-sync-daemon

Dev Edition:
* First public release
* Added: xterm, openssh
* Enabled: VTs, ssh server

Known bugs:
* Blinking cursors in QEMU and Virtualbox with std driver
* Segmentation fault in QEMU with SPICE qxl driver

Changelog:
* Fixed adeskbar panel size with autosize script
* Optimized bookmark panel for 1024px wide
* Added a lot of new bookmarks
* Added Firefox extensions: hide my ass, menu icons plus, offline qr generator, turn off the lights
* Added Chrome extensions: addthis, chrome to mobile, hide my ass, save to google drive, screen capture
* Firefox 20.0.1 and Google Chrome 28.0.1485.0 dev
* Updated to linux kernel 3.8.10
* Added blog posts
* Revised homepage again

Known bugs:
* Lockscreen wallpaper still cut off
* Max resolution 1024x768 in QEMU
* Setting -vga to vmware results in black screen

Changelog:
* Updated to latest packages
* Added More in Content UI addon
* Removed Offline QR generator addon
* Added vmware drivers

Known bugs:
* Max resolution 1024x768 in QEMU
* Setting -vga to vmware results in black screen

Changelog:
* Revised homepage again
* Added social networking

Changelog:
* Revamped the github homepage
* Wrote a SourceForge scraper to more accurately monitor downloads
* Updated to latest packages

Feature To-do:
* Replace buggy "Offline QR generator" addon with qr-send script

Changelog:
* Added "More In Content UI" Firefox addon
* Froze linux kernel to 3.7.10 until 3.8+ screen resolution bug fixed upstream
* Updated to latest packages (wayland pulled in)

Feature To-do:
* Replace buggy "Offline QR generator" addon with qr-send script
* Personas?
* Add bookmarks: jolicloud, rollapp, pixlr, draftin ?
* Test more addons
* Try to get radiotray working

Changelog:
* First public release
* Uploaded ISO to SourceForge
* A lot more added to github repos
* Updated to latest

Changelog:
* Fixed ethernet bug
* Released source to github

Feature to-do:
* Release more to github
* Upload ISO to sourceforge

Changelog:
* Upgrade to kernel 3.7.9
* Set ui.allow_platform_file_picker to false in Firefox
* Added bookmark: http://www.google.com/insidesearch/tipstricks/basics.html
* Added firefox bookmark: chrome://browser/content/places/places.xul
* Added chrome bookmarks: chrome://history, chrome://bookmarks
* Fixed lockscreen
* Fixed Google Drive icon

Known bugs:
* Ethernet doesn't connect by default!

Changelog:
* Created new 24px icons
* Created new 16px icons
* Decreased panel from 48px to 24px
* Revamped wageclock layout
* Added features to wageclock
* Fixed buttons in timers
* Added keybindings to calculator
* Removed Aardvark from bookmarks toolbar
* Added [Search] Tips bookmark
* Added Places bookmark
* Added /usr/bin/firefox as file handler
* Added Offline QR generator to Firefox

Known bugs:
* Calculator clear bug with keyboard

Feature To-do:
* Set ui.allow_platform_file_picker to false in Firefox
* Add bookmark: http://www.google.com/insidesearch/tipstricks/basics.html
* Add bookmark: chrome://browser/content/places/places.xul
* Fix drive icon by clicking "learn more"
* Fix patched lockscreen

Changelog:
* Added vga=791 to fix glitching caused by quiet
* Re-added VT lockout
* Fixed calculator error message
* Renamed "Most Visited" to "Recent"
* Added playlist.com to bookmarks
* Added www.playlist.com to Chrome whitelist
* Implemented autosize backgrounds script

Known bugs:
* x86_64 drivers not working
* Bootsplash distorted with Nouveau

Feature To-do:
* Create x86_64 /usr/lib/modules squashfs
* Fix webapp icons
* Modify wageclock

Changelog:
* Generated x86_64 initrd
* Appended quiet splash to boot menu
* Boot splash now working
* Added 3 second timeout
* Fixed bootsplash logo

Known bugs:
* x86_64 drivers not working
* Distorted boot pre-splash
* Calculator max digits length error incorrect

Feature To-do:
* Create x86_64 /usr/lib/modules squashfs
* Implement new backgrounds
* Add playlist.com to bookmarks
* Fix webapp icons
* Modify wageclock

Changelog:
* Updated to latest packages
* Updated live tools to ARCH_201301
* Added x86_64 kernel
* Disabled VT lockout temporarily
* Added bootsplash
* Added dx to bookmarks
* Fixed duckduckgo icon in Firefox
* Added www.youtube.com to Chrome flash whitelist
* Enabled flashblock in Firefox via Toolbar Buttons extension
* Removed quickjava extension
* Created wallpapers and lockscreen for alternate resolutions
* Added package list to livecd

Known bugs:
* Boot menu overlaps logo
* x86_64 kernel does not boot properly

Feature To-do:
* Custom lock dialog
* Implement new backgrounds
* Debug kernel panics
* Fix webapp icons
* Modify wageclock

Changelog:
* Fixed wifi key dialog (installed: network-manager-applet-gtk2, gnome-keyring, gcr, libcap-ng)
* Fixed touchpad configuration (/etc/X11/xorg.d/10-synaptics.conf)
* Added gmail video chat plugin
* Increased panel from 32px icons to 48px
* Added i3 "secret" hotkeys
* Fixed i3lock hotkey
* Fixed calculator daisy-chain operations
* Fixed calculator long numbers
* Expanded calculator from 9 to 11 digit display
* Added calculator buttons: plus/minus, square root, exponent, pi constant, e constant
* Added finer grain timer intervals
* Fixed eggtimer logic
* Created stopwatch and egg background images for timers
* Fixed character 1 width in DS-Digital font with fontforge

Known bugs:
* Kernel panic on plug in usb wifi card
* File-handlers default to Firefox
* Wallpaper stretched horizontally
* Lockscreen cut-off vertically
* Filesystem not hidden from user/browser (need to try sandfox again)
* Livecd: Boot messages are displayed
* Livecd: Splash screen not working
* Livecd: Slow bootup as filesystem uncompressed
* Livecd: Syslinux bootscreen is ugly

Feature To-do:
* Custom lock dialog
* Alter wallpaper dimensions
* Debug kernel panics
* Fix webapp icons
* Modify wageclock
* Add www.youtube.com to chrome whitelist
* Fix firefox/chrome bookmark icons
* Add dealextreme to shopping bookmarks

Changelog:
* Updated to latest. Firefox 18/Chrome 24
* Added webapps: notes, calculator, timer, email, wageclock
* Added bookmarks to Chrome
* Modded lockscreen: height, mouse and other
* Added wbar to lockscreen
* Cleanup

Known bugs:
* Inherits existing bugs
* Kernel panic on plug in usb wifi card
* Calculator needs substring(0,9) for small numbers
* Calulator needs equals() between operations
* Eggtimer bugs
* File-handlers default to Firefox

Feature To-do:
* Gmail video chat plugin: google-talkplugin
* Touchpad changes: xf86-input-synaptics libsynaptics /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/10-synaptics.conf
* "Skin" timer "app"
* Custom lock dialog
* Alter wallpaper dimensions
* Debug wireless issues
* Enable i3 WM mode toggle
* Fix webapp icons

Changelog:
* First actually working livecd
* Fixed chainload issue by deleting fstab
* Fixed firefox close button via Toolbar Buttons extension
* Removed ctrl+f = fullscreen keybinding in i3 config
* Fixed keyboard volume bindings with pulseaudio_ctl

Known bugs:
* Wallpaper stretched horizontally
* Lockscreen cut-off vertically
* Touchpad clickpad enabled
* Touchpad two-finger scrolling enabled (prefer scroll on right)
* Possible Chrome browser forkbomb issue
* Clicking wireless network won't connect (because the WPA key dialog doesn't popup)
* Filesystem not hidden from user/browser (need to try sandfox again)
* Boot messages are displayed in livecd
* Splash screen not working in livecd
* Slow bootup as filesystem uncompressed
* Syslinux bootscreen is ugly

Tested with:
* ATI Radeon Express 200 (radeon driver)
* Intel 945GMS (intel driver)
* Nvidia Geforce 7600 Go (nouveau driver)
* I-ODD livecd (55 seconds from isolinux->firefox)
* CD-R livecd (2 minutes 15 seconds from isolinux->firefox)

Untested:
* USB boot
* webcam
* microphone

Changelog:
* First conversion from dev install to livecd
* Configuration of Firefox modified
* Configuration of Chrome modified
* Configuration of i3 tweaked

Known bugs:
* "Working" 0.1-6 is just chainloading to hdd
* Upper-right close button doesn't close firefox, just the tab
* CTRL+F = fullscreen instead of find
* Keyboard vol+/- don't work
* Fallback initramfs doesn't work
* Possible Chrome browser forkbomb issue
* Clicking wireless network won't connect because the WPA key dialog doesn't popup.
* Filesystem not hidden from user/browser (need to try sandfox again)
* Boot messages aren't hidden
* Splash screen not working
* Slow bootup as filesystem uncompressed
* Syslinux bootscreen is ugly

Changelog:
* Added i3 lockscreen
* Browser profiles stored in RAM
* Disabled VTs
* Disabled SSH
* Disabled panel preferences

Feature To-do:
* Sandbox browsers (sandfox not working)
* Shutdown in lockscreen (physical power button sends graceful shutdown though)

Changelog:
* Added i3 WM
* Added Mozilla Firefox
* Added Google Chrome
* Added adeskbar

Feature To-do:
* Add lockscreen

Changelog:
* Tested various light-weight WMs
* Tested various browser addons
* Tested various panel docks
* Tested various lockscreens
